report:
EXAMEN DEMANDE : IRM CEREBRALE
INDICATION : HEMIPARESIE GAUCHE D’INSTALLATION IL Y A ENVIRON 1 MOIS
MEDECIN TRAITANT : 



TECHNIQUE : (IRM PHILLIPS MULTIVA 1. 5 T R 5. 3 installée en Juin 2019) 

3D FLAIR, T1 et T2  
Axial VenBold ; Diffusion et T2 Drive ; 
3D TOF du polygone de Willis et Veinogramme.

RESULTATS  

Hypersignal capsulo-lenticulaire droit en Flair et Diffusion avec une restriction de l’ADC (0,58.10-3 mm2/s) en faveur d’un AVC ischémique subaigu.
Hypersignaux Flair diffus de la substance blanche péri-ventriculaire et des centres sémi-ovales en faveur d’une leucopathie vasculaire évoluée Fazekas 3.
Absence de stigmate hémorragique en Ven Bold.
Absence d’anomalie des ventricules, des vallées sylviennes et des sillons corticaux.
Intégrité du vermis, du tronc cérébral et des hémisphères cérébelleux.
Absence d’anomalie du polygone de Willis.

CONCLUSION

ASPECT IRM EN FAVEUR D’UN AVC ISCHEMIQUE SUBAIGU CAPSULO-LENTICULAIRE DROIT SUR LEUCOPATHIE VASCULAIRE FAZEKAS 3.
translation:
EXAM REQUEST: BRAIN MRI  
INDICATION: LEFT-SIDED HEMIPARESIS ONSET APPROXIMATELY 1 MONTH AGO  
REFERRING PHYSICIAN:  

TECHNIQUE: (PHILIPS MULTIVA 1.5 T MRI, installed June 2019)  

3D FLAIR, T1 and T2  
Axial VenBold; Diffusion and T2 Drive;  
3D TOF of the Circle of Willis and Venogram.

RESULTS  

Right capsulo-lenticular hyperintensity on FLAIR and Diffusion with ADC restriction (0.58 x 10^-3 mm²/s) suggestive of a subacute ischemic stroke.  
Diffuse FLAIR hyperintensities in the periventricular white matter and semi-oval centers indicative of advanced vascular leukoencephalopathy, Fazekas grade 3.  
No hemorrhagic stigmata on VenBold.  
No abnormalities in the ventricles, Sylvian fissures, or cortical sulci.  
Intact vermis, brainstem, and cerebellar hemispheres.  
No abnormalities in the Circle of Willis.

CONCLUSION  

MRI findings suggestive of a right capsulo-lenticular subacute ischemic stroke on a background of Fazekas grade 3 vascular leukoencephalopathy.

Intégrité du vermis, du tronc cérébral et des hémisphères cérébelleux.  
Absence d’anomalie du polygone de Willis.  

CONCLUSION  

ASPECT IRM PAS EN FAVEUR D’UN AVC ISCHÉMIQUE SUBAIGU CAPSULO-LENTICULAIRE DROIT SUR LEUCOPATHIE VASCULAIRE FAZEKAS 3.

INDICATION: LEFT-SIDED HEMIPARESIS ONSET APPROXIMATELY 1 MONTH AGO  
REFERRING PHYSICIAN:  

TECHNIQUE: (PHILIPS MULTIVA 1.5 T MRI, installed June 2019)  

3D FLAIR, T1 and T2  
Axial VenBold; Diffusion and T2 Drive;  
3D TOF of the Circle of Willis and Venogram.

RESULTS  

Right capsulo-lenticular hyperintensity on FLAIR and Diffusion with ADC restriction (0.58 x 10^-3 mm²/s) suggestive of a subacute ischemic stroke.  
Diffuse FLAIR hyperintensities in the periventricular white matter and semi-oval centers indicative of advanced vascular leukoencephalopathy, Fazekas grade 3.  
No hemorrhagic stigmata on VenBold.  
No abnormalities in the ventricles, Sylvian fissures, or cortical sulci.  
Intact vermis, brainstem, and cerebellar hemispheres.  
No abnormalities in the Circle of Willis.

CONCLUSION  

MRI findings not suggestive of a right capsulo-lenticular subacute ischemic stroke on a background of Fazekas grade 3 vascular leukoencephalopathy.

Acquisition cérébrale multiplanaire en séquence T1, T2, T2FFE, Flair, Ven Bold, Diffusion, 3RXOF du polygone de Willis, Venogramme.

RESULTATS :
Séquelle ischémique lacunaire de la tête du noyau caudé droit.

Intégrité des noyaux gris centraux.

translation:
EXAM REQUESTED: BRAIN MRI  
INDICATION: INVESTIGATION OF IDEOMOTOR SLOWING  
             GAIT DISTURBANCE (SHUFFLING GAIT)  
             IN A PATIENT WITH A HISTORY OF ISCHEMIC STROKE  
             SEARCH FOR LESIONS IN THE BASAL GANGLIA OR ELSEWHERE  

TECHNIQUE: (PHILIPS MULTIVA 1.5 T MRI INSTALLED IN JUNE 2019)  

Multiplanar brain acquisition using T1, T2, T2FFE, Flair, Ven Bold, Diffusion sequences, 3RXOF of the Circle of Willis, Venogram.

RESULTS:  
Lacunar ischemic sequelae in the head of the right caudate nucleus.  
Flair hyperintensities in the periventricular white matter and semi-oval centers suggestive of Fazekas grade 2 vascular leukoencephalopathy.  
Intact basal ganglia.  
No ischemic lesions on Diffusion.  
No hemorrhagic signs on Ven Bold.  
Midline structures are in place.  
No signal abnormalities in the vermis, brainstem, or cerebellar hemispheres.  
No abnormalities in the Circle of Willis and venous network.  
No intracranial mass effect.  
Normal appearance of the ventricles.

Additionally, bilateral ethmoidal sinusitis.

CONCLUSION:  
LACUNAR ISCHEMIC SEQUELAE IN THE HEAD OF THE RIGHT CAUDATE NUCLEUS.  
EARLY VASCULAR LEUKOENCEPHALOPATHY FAZEKAS GRADE 2.  
NO RECENT ISCHEMIC, TUMORAL, OR HEMORRHAGIC LESIONS.

ADDITIONALLY, BILATERAL ETHMOIDAL SINUSITIS.
